channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2150] Michael Scott's diploma...Just noticed what it says.
[+1418] Best Buy Firing Employee Because of a iPhone4 Video
item.description: There's an amusing video making the rounds mocking iPhone-obsessed buyers going into stores and not caring that phones like the HTC Evo might have better specs, because they just "want an iPhone." What does is Best Buy's incredible stupidity about the video. Wait, you might ask, what does the video have to do with Best Buy?

item.title: [+1371] Goodbye HDMI, Hello HDBaseT
item.description: LG Electronics, Samsung Electronics, Sony Pictures Entertainment and VS have been secretly conspiring to kill HDMI. And today they set their plans into motion, introducing a brand new audiovisual standard, HDBaseT. While that name may sound confusing, before you slap your head, this will not likely introduce a new kind of cable to your house.

item.title: [+1217] 8 Historic Symbols That Mean The Opposite of What You Think
item.description: What do you do if the real world doesn't provide you with something people can rally around? Just go ahead an embellish the truth.

item.title: [+1051] Breathe, damn you, breathe! (IMG)
[+880] Fastest "Whac-A-Mole" Cat (Video)
item.description: This is like a jack-in-the-box, but much edgier. There's no sissy music, and there's a 50% chance of multiple lacerations.

item.title: [+790] Diver "Vanishes" in Portal to Maya Underworld (VIDEO)
item.description: Diving into natural pools in Belize in the quest for offerings from the ancient Maya, explorers found what's believed to be the country's first recorded fossil

item.title: [+739] World cup: Argentina crushed by the German football machine
item.description: Germany destroys Maradonna's stars 4-0 to steam into the last four.

item.title: [+660] Don't ask for a Group Discount! [PIC]
[+634] World's Greatest Homeless Sign Ever! [PIC]
item.description: There is no question in my mind that this is the greatest and most creative homeless sign I've ever seen.

item.title: [+591] Fox News Reporter vs. Libraries
item.description: "Are libraries necessary, or a waste of tax money?" The headline for Anna Davlante's post on Fox Chicago News is phrased as a question, but it seems like she's got a particular answer in mind.

item.title: [+538] IT Crowd-The Game
item.description: You love the show, now play the game.

item.title: [+483] For The Love of God, Someone Rename ‘5nal Destination'
item.description: This mediocre thriller series, Final Destination, has rolled out with perhaps the worst name for a sequel ever. Why, oh why?

item.title: [+474] M. Night Shyamalan Finally Made A Comedy
item.description: You giggled at The Happening. You snorted at The Village. But now, for the first time ever, former indie auteur M. Night Shyamalan has set out to make a gonzo comedy on purpose, with The Last Airbender. Spoilers ahead!

item.title: [+435] Internet Explorer (even IE6!) gains market share
item.description: Internet Explorer has gained market share for the first month in quite a while. So has its most hated version, IE6.

item.title: [+434] Just how large is the INTERNET? [Infographic]
item.description: We all know the internet is huge (that’s what she said)! But did you know that its soooo big its impossible to measure? Check for yourself.

item.title: [+418] Paris Hilton arrested for smoking marijuana in South Africa
item.description: Paris Hilton has been arrested in South Africa for allegedly smoking marijuana during a World Cup match.

item.title: [+413] M.C. Escher in LEGO
item.description: I'm sure a lot of you like the art of M.C. Escher and playing with LEGO, but Andrew Lipson and Daniel Shiu really managed to combine the two into an amazing example of geek art.

item.title: [+390] 10 of The Greatest Apple Stores From Around The World (PICS)
item.description: What is surprising, though, is the fact that Apple incorporates its iconic design into all of its retail Apple Stores and this makes for very awe-inspiring buildings.

item.title: [+382] Post mortem: KIN's tragic demise (and the fading of Danger)
item.description: The KIN was a good idea—18 months ago. Ars takes an in-depth look at why the device was delayed, why it was priced so badly, and how it failed as a Sidekick successor.
